article_title: After the Fed, Sterling’s Soggy Performance May Persist
article_text:
The festive season is looming, but the pound is showing a distinct lack of sparkle. This year sterling has fallen 4.5% against the dollar, and December has seen a fresh downdraft to just under $1.49. The currency may struggle to shine next year too.

The immediate cause of sterling’s weakness is the shifting sands at the Bank of England, where the prospect of a rate increase has been diminishing even as the U.S. Federal Reserve...

twitter.description: The pound has suffered as U.S. and U.K. prospects diverge. The intensifying debate on EU membership may weigh further on sterling.
twitter.creator: @RichardBarley1
